intro: Leptoderris glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
